channel.title: Player Saving
channel.description:
How do I make a Player file save, when.
[ul][li]They log out.[/li] [li]They close there client.[/li] [li]There server gets turned off.[/li] [li]They Disconnect.[/li][/ul]
I want there to be no mistakes in the server saving, so that if they do something it saves. i don't want to use the save timer because it lags the server.
I'm using Emulous Base.
Thanks. :)

item.title: Player Saving
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

a) Find the logout method, add the save method at the bottom
b) You can’t do this directly, but you can set a timeout disconnection (like RuneScape), in which after a specific amount of time has passed with no packets sent, you would kick and save them
c) Do you mean when the server force-shutdowns (like a power outage)? No way to prevent this unless you call automatic saving (not effective)
d) Same thing with A

Read full topic

item.title: Player Saving
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

How do I make a Player file save, when.

[ul][li]They log out.[/li]
[li]They close there client.[/li]
[li]There server gets turned off.[/li]
[li]They Disconnect.[/li][/ul]

I want there to be no mistakes in the server saving, so that if they do something it saves. i don’t want to use the save timer because it lags the server.

I’m using Emulous Base.

Thanks.
